medical_qa.question: Are group 2 innate lymphoid cells ( ILC2s ) increased in chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps or eosinophilia?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: ILC2 frequencies are increased in chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps, high tissue eosinophilia, and eosinophil-dominant CRS. They are also associated with increased blood eosinophilia and nasal symptom score in CRS.

medical_qa.question: Does vagus nerve contribute to the development of steatohepatitis and obesity in phosphatidylethanolamine N-methyltransferase deficient mice?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Neuronal signals via the hepatic vagus nerve contribute to the development of steatohepatitis and protection against obesity in HFD fed Pemt(-/-) mice.

medical_qa.question: Does psammaplin A induce Sirtuin 1-dependent autophagic cell death in doxorubicin-resistant MCF-7/adr human breast cancer cells and xenografts?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Psammaplin A inhibited MCF-7/adr cell proliferation, arrested cells in G2/M phase, reduced SIRT1 activity and protein expression, increased p53 acetylation, and upregulated autophagy-related proteins including DRAM.

medical_qa.question: Is methylation of the FGFR2 gene associated with high birth weight centile in humans?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Methylation of the FGFR2 gene remained significantly associated with high birth weight centile.

medical_qa.question: Do tumor-infiltrating immune cell profiles and their change after neoadjuvant chemotherapy predict response and prognosis of breast cancer?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Breast cancer immune cell subpopulation profiles, determined by immunohistochemistry-based computerized analysis, can predict response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy and prognosis post-treatment.

medical_qa.question: Is hidradenitis suppurativa a systemic disease with substantial comorbidity burden : a chart-verified case-control analysis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Control subjects were not validated for absence of HS and comorbidity validation was not performed for either group.

medical_qa.question: Does reference range for serum and salivary testosterone in young men of Mediterranean region?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: In young men from the Mediterranean region, total testosterone (TT) levels above 9.7 nmol/L, calculated free testosterone (CFT) levels above 0.22 nmol/L, and/or calculated bioavailable testosterone (CBT) levels above 4.9 nmol/L suggest the absence of biochemical hypogonadism. The clinical significance of salivary testosterone (ST) in comparison to serum testosterone is yet to be determined.

medical_qa.question: Are secretory phospholipases A2 secreted from ciliated cells and increase mucin and eicosanoid secretion from goblet cells?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: sPLA2 are secreted from ciliated cells and induce mucin and cysLT secretion from goblet cells.

medical_qa.question: Is admission hyperglycemia associated with failed reperfusion following fibrinolytic therapy in patients with STEMI : results of a retrospective study?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Admission hyperglycemia is an independent predictor of failed reperfusion in STEMI patients undergoing fibrinolytic therapy.

medical_qa.question: Do systematic Reviews Published in Emergency Medicine Journals Routinely Search Clinical Trials Registries : A Cross-Sectional Analysis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Systematic reviews published in emergency medicine journals do not routinely include searches of clinical trials registries.

medical_qa.question: Do obese patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis have a higher 90-day mortality risk with bilateral lung transplantation?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Obese patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis who receive a bilateral lung transplant may have a higher risk of 90-day mortality compared to patients of normal weight.

medical_qa.question: Does promoter variant rs2301228 on the neural cell adhesion molecule 1 gene confer risk of schizophrenia in Han Chinese?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study found that the promoter variant rs2301228 on the neural cell adhesion molecule 1 gene is associated with schizophrenia in Han Chinese, suggesting NCAM1 as a susceptibility gene for the disorder.

medical_qa.question: Are higher nitric oxide levels associated with disease activity in Egyptian rheumatoid arthritis patients?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Increased nitric oxide levels in the serum of patients with rheumatoid arthritis correlate significantly with disease activity, inflammatory markers, and radiological joint status.

medical_qa.question: Does increased Syk phosphorylation lead to overexpression of TRAF6 in peripheral B cells of patients with systemic lupus erythematosus?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Increased Syk phosphorylation leads to overexpression of TRAF6 in peripheral B cells of patients with systemic lupus erythematosus.

medical_qa.question: Are reasons why erupted third molars extracted in a public university in Mexico?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Erupted third molars were extracted more frequently in women and patients aged 18 to 34, primarily for prosthetic reasons.

medical_qa.question: Does the Boston keratoprosthesis provide a wide depth of focus?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The Boston keratoprosthesis provides a wide depth of focus, reducing the dependence on precise refractive correction for distance vision, possibly due to its small pupil diameter.

medical_qa.question: Do large portion sizes increase bite size and eating rate in overweight women?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Increasing portion size led to a larger bite size and faster eating rate, but a slower reduction in eating speed during the meal.

medical_qa.question: Are routine preoperative restaging CTs after neoadjuvant chemoradiation for locally advanced rectal cancer low yield : a retrospective case study?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Restaging CT scans after neoadjuvant chemoradiation for locally advanced rectal cancer did not change surgical management in this retrospective case study. Selective approach to preoperative imaging may be advisable to minimize costs and risks.

medical_qa.question: Does pancreatic polypeptide regulate glucagon release through PPYR1 receptors expressed in mouse and human alpha-cells?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Glucose stimulates PP secretion and PP inhibits glucagon release in mouse pancreatic islets. PP receptors are present in alpha-cells of mouse and human pancreatic islets.

medical_qa.question: Do two decades of British newspaper coverage regarding attempt cardiopulmonary resuscitation decisions : Lessons for clinicians?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The main themes identified in two decades of British newspaper coverage on Do Not Attempt Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (DNACPR) decisions were lack of patient and surrogate involvement, negative language when decisions were perceived as unilateral, and the recommendation for increased dialogue and shared decision-making.

medical_qa.question: Is increased time from neoadjuvant chemoradiation to surgery associated with higher pathologic complete response rates in esophageal cancer?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: A longer interval between neoadjuvant chemoradiation and surgery was linked to higher pathologic complete response rates in esophageal cancer, with no effect on surgical morbidity.

medical_qa.question: Is epileptic focus localization based on resting state interictal MEG recordings feasible irrespective of the presence or absence of spikes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Accurate localization of the epileptogenic focus may be achieved using noninvasive resting-state MEG recordings, regardless of the presence or absence of spikes.

medical_qa.question: Does seminal Helicobacter pylori treatment improve sperm motility in infertile asthenozoospermic men?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Treatment of seminal Helicobacter pylori in infertile asthenozoospermic men with elevated H pylori IgA significantly improves sperm motility.

medical_qa.question: Does a migrating ciliary gate compartmentalize the site of axoneme assembly in Drosophila spermatids?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The ciliary gate can migrate away from the base of the cilium to compartmentalize the site of axoneme assembly independently of the centriole and axoneme interaction.

medical_qa.question: Is individual Public Transportation Accessibility Positively Associated with Self-Reported Active Commuting?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study found that individual public transportation accessibility is positively associated with self-reported active commuting, especially for those residing within 10 km commute distance and in areas of high accessibility.

medical_qa.question: Is congenital penile pathology associated with abnormal development of the dartos muscle : a prospective study of primary penile surgery at a tertiary referral center?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Congenital penile pathology (hypospadias, buried penis) is associated with structural anomalies in dartos tissue.

medical_qa.question: Is δNp63 expression a protective factor of progression in clinical high grade T1 bladder cancer?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: ΔNp63 expression is a favorable prognostic factor in clinically high grade T1 bladder cancer.

medical_qa.question: Do high levels of procalcitonin in the early phase after pediatric liver transplantation indicate poor postoperative outcome?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: High levels of procalcitonin after pediatric liver transplantation are associated with poor postoperative outcomes and may indicate ischemia-induced liver cell injury in the setting of ischemia-reperfusion injury.

medical_qa.question: Is decreased expression of liver-type fatty acid-binding protein associated with poor prognosis in hepatocellular carcinoma?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Decreased expression of liver-type fatty acid-binding protein in hepatocellular carcinoma was associated with a better prognosis.

medical_qa.question: Does ephrin type-B receptor 4 activation reduce neointimal hyperplasia in human saphenous vein in vitro?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Eph-B4 is functional in adult human saphenous veins, capable of NO release and preventing neointimal hyperplasia in vitro. Ephrin-B2/Fc activates endothelial Eph-B4 in saphenous veins under arterial shear stress in vitro.

medical_qa.question: Are low serum levels of vitamin D associated with post-stroke depression?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Serum vitamin D levels within 24 hours after admission are associated with post-stroke depression and may predict its development at 1 month post-stroke.

medical_qa.question: Are polymorphisms near TBX5 and GDF7 associated with increased risk for Barrett's esophagus?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Polymorphisms near TBX5 and GDF7 were identified as associated with risk for Barrett's esophagus.

medical_qa.question: Does danzhi Xiaoyao San ameliorate depressive-like behavior by shifting toward serotonin via the downregulation of hippocampal indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: DXS exhibited antidepressant-like effects on rats exposed to CUMS by reducing IDO activity to shift the balance of the Kyn/5-HT pathway toward the 5-HT pathway.

medical_qa.question: Is p63 more sensitive and specific than 34βE12 to differentiate adenocarcinoma of prostate from cancer mimickers?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Basal cell markers can help to distinguish prostate adenocarcinoma from cancer mimickers.

medical_qa.question: Does poor sleep predict symptoms of depression and disability retirement due to depression?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Lack of baseline diagnostic interviews; sleep quality based on self-report.

medical_qa.question: Are phospholipase C epsilon 1 ( PLCE1 ) haplotypes associated with increased risk of gastric cancer in Kashmir Valley?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Variation in PLCE1 may be associated with GC risk in Kashmir Valley.

medical_qa.question: Is TGFBI Expression in Cancer Stromal Cells Associated with Poor Prognosis and Hematogenous Recurrence in Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: High TGFBI expression in ESCC tissues is linked to poor prognosis and hematogenous recurrence. TGFBI in stromal cells could be a potential target for ESCC treatment.

medical_qa.question: Are autoimmune features associated with chronic antibiotic-refractory pouchitis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Certain immune markers overlap in patients with pouch dysfunction, particularly in chronic antibiotic-refractory pouchitis (CARP). Microsomal antibody expression and increased IgG4-positive plasma cell infiltration are independent risk factors for CARP.

medical_qa.question: Does identical ATP1A3 mutation cause alternating hemiplegia of childhood and rapid-onset dystonia parkinsonism phenotypes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The discordance of these phenotypes suggests that there are other undiscovered environmental, genetic, or epigenetic factors influencing the development of alternating hemiplegia of childhood or rapid-onset dystonia parkinsonism.

medical_qa.question: Does metabolic control analysis of the Trypanosoma cruzi peroxide detoxification pathway identify tryparedoxin as a suitable drug target?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Metabolic control analysis identified tryparedoxin as a potential drug target due to its low catalytic efficiency and high control on peroxide detoxification flux.

medical_qa.question: Is basal Flt1 tyrosine kinase activity a positive regulator of endothelial survival and vascularization during zebrafish embryogenesis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Flt1-tyrosine kinase (TK) activity plays a role in endothelial cell survival and vascular development during zebrafish embryo angiogenesis by involving the PI3K/Akt pathway.

medical_qa.question: Do immunizations with hepatitis B viral antigens and a TLR7/8 agonist adjuvant induce antigen-specific immune responses in HBV-transgenic mice?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Immunization with CL097-conjugated HBV-Ag reversed immune tolerance in HBV-Tg mice and induced antigen-specific immune responses. TLR7/8 agonists are potent adjuvants for inducing antigen-specific Th1 responses in an immune tolerant state.

medical_qa.question: Are lobar microbleeds associated with a decline in executive functioning in older adults?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Lobar microbleeds are associated with an accelerated rate of executive function decline in older adults, suggesting a potential role of cerebral amyloid angiopathy in cognitive decline.

medical_qa.question: Is self-reported physical activity in smoking pre-cessation a protective factor against relapse for all?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Physical activity was not found to be a significant predictor of smoking relapse, except for a positive interaction with antidepressant use.

medical_qa.question: Is breathlessness at rest the dominant presentation of patients admitted with heart failure?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Shortness of breath at rest is not the dominant presentation of patients admitted with heart failure. Many patients are comfortable at rest but experience breathlessness on slight exertion (CARBOSE), which may indicate more severe right heart dysfunction and worse prognosis.

medical_qa.question: Is delayed duodenal stump blow-out following total gastrectomy for cancer a case report?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The present report describes a case of delayed duodenal stump disruption following total gastrectomy with Roux-en-Y esophagojejunostomy for cancer.

medical_qa.question: Are lipoprotein phospholipase A2 mass and activity associated with the diagnosis of acute brain ischemia?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study results do not support using Lp-PLA2 mass or activity levels early on to confirm an ischemic cause in patients with minor or transient focal neurological events.

medical_qa.question: Is osteoprotegerin associated with subclinical left ventricular systolic dysfunction in diabetic hypertensive patients : a speckle tracking study?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Plasma OPG values could predict subclinical LV systolic dysfunction in diabetic hypertensive patients.

medical_qa.question: Do a new model for the standardization of experimental burn wounds?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The report describes a burn apparatus with an innovative method of animal fixation to produce burns of varying sizes and depths in rats, allowing for precise temperature control and standardized animal positioning.

medical_qa.question: Does circulating atrial natriuretic peptide genetic association study identify a novel gene cluster associated with stroke in whites?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: This study identified genetic variants in the MTHFR-CLCN6-NPPA-NPPB cluster significantly associated with NT-proANP levels. Carriers of a specific variant had lower NT-proANP levels, higher blood pressures, and an increased risk of stroke.

medical_qa.question: Do whole-genome sequencing and epidemiological analysis provide evidence for cross-transmission of mycobacterium abscessus in a cohort of pediatric cystic fibrosis patients?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Whole-genome sequencing data showed no cross-transmission of M. abscessus within the hospital, except between 1 sibling pair. Further investigation is needed to explore alternative routes of infection acquisition.

medical_qa.question: Are high Atopobium vaginae and Gardnerella vaginalis vaginal loads associated with preterm birth?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: High vaginal loads of Atopobium vaginae and Gardnerella vaginalis are associated with preterm birth in high-risk pregnancies.

medical_qa.question: Is cD30 expression a novel prognostic indicator in extranodal natural killer/T-cell lymphoma, nasal type?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: CD30 expression was not related to treatment response but was an independent prognostic factor for both overall survival (OS) and progression-free survival (PFS) in extranodal natural killer/T-cell lymphoma, nasal type.

medical_qa.question: Do [ Clinical study on continuous plasma filtration absorption treatment for burn sepsis ]?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Continuous plasma filtration absorption (CPFA) treatment showed positive therapeutic effects on burn sepsis by reducing pro-inflammatory cytokine levels, alleviating systemic inflammation, and enhancing immune status.

medical_qa.question: Do Perinatal variables from newborns of Aymara mothers suggest a genetic adaptation to high altitude?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Altitude of residence is related to a decrease in perinatal variables that proved to be less pronounced in newborns of mothers with a higher degree of Aymara ancestry.

medical_qa.question: Is 25-hydroxyvitamin D status associated with chronic cerebral small vessel disease?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: 25(OH)D is inversely associated with lacunes, white matter hyperintensity, and deep CMB, suggesting a link to small vessel disease.

medical_qa.question: Is cD133-positive tumor cell content a predictor of early recurrence in colorectal cancer?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: CD133 is a valid marker for identifying cancer stem cells in fresh surgically resected colorectal cancer tissues.

medical_qa.question: Does traumatic brain injury induce neuroinflammation and neuronal degeneration that is associated with escalated alcohol self-administration in rats?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study found an association between post-TBI escalation of alcohol drinking and localized neuroinflammation at the site of injury. Baseline alcohol preference was also relevant in determining post-TBI alcohol drinking.

medical_qa.question: Does maternal undernutrition induce premature reproductive senescence in adult female rat offspring?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Maternal undernutrition can induce premature reproductive senescence in adult female rat offspring by altering the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis, potentially due to the development of obesity and hyperleptinemia in these animals.

medical_qa.question: Does granulocyte colony-stimulating factor prevent loss of spermatogenesis after sterilizing busulfan chemotherapy?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF) protects spermatogenesis from gonadotoxic insult (busulfan) in rodents by acting on CSF3R+ undifferentiated spermatogonia, suggesting it could be beneficial in preserving male fertility in cancer patients undergoing sterilizing treatments.

medical_qa.question: Is saikosaponin b2 a naturally occurring terpenoid that efficiently inhibits hepatitis C virus entry?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Saikosaponin b2 efficiently inhibits hepatitis C virus entry, making it a potential candidate for development as an antagonist of HCV entry and prophylactic treatment during liver transplantation.

medical_qa.question: Does autotaxin activity have a high accuracy to diagnose intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Increased serum autotaxin activity is a highly sensitive and specific diagnostic marker for intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy, distinguishing it from other pregnancy-related disorders.

medical_qa.question: Does a dedicated research program increase the quantity and quality of orthopaedic resident publications?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Implementation of a dedicated resident research program improves the quantity and to some extent quality of orthopaedic resident research publications during residency, but this effect did not persist after graduation.

medical_qa.question: Does cationic Nanogel-mediated Runx2 and Osterix siRNA Delivery decrease Mineralization in MC3T3 Cells?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: RNAi treatments against Runx2 and Osx reduced gene expression and ALP activity, but did not completely eliminate mineralization processes in MC3T3 cells. Targeting mid- and late-stage osteoblast differentiation markers with RNAi may be more effective for heterotopic ossification prophylaxis.

medical_qa.question: Do no sex differences exist in posterior condylar offsets of the knee?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Males had greater posterior condylar offset and total condylar height at the medial and lateral femoral condyles compared to females, but there were no sex differences in the ratio of posterior condylar offset to condylar height at either condyle.

medical_qa.question: Do gene polymorphisms of stress hormone and cytokine receptors associate with immunomodulatory profile and psychological measurement?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Gene polymorphisms from various components of the psychoneuroendocrine-immune network may serve as biomarkers for categorizing individual stress-associated immune responses.

medical_qa.question: Does housing temperature influence the pattern of heat shock protein induction in mice following mild whole body hyperthermia?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Housing temperature significantly influences the expression of heat shock proteins in mice after whole body heating and should be considered when studying stress responses in mice.

medical_qa.question: Does intra-articular injection of synthetic microRNA-210 accelerate avascular meniscal healing in rat medial meniscal injured model?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Intra-articular injection of ds miR-210 promoted healing of the damaged white zone meniscus by increasing collagen type 2 production in meniscus cells and upregulating VEGF and FGF2 in synovial cells.

medical_qa.question: Does pRMT5 enhance generation of induced pluripotent stem cells from dairy goat embryonic fibroblasts via down-regulation of p53?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study suggests that PRMT5 overexpression enhances the generation of induced pluripotent stem cells from dairy goat embryonic fibroblasts by down-regulating p53, promoting somatic cell reprogramming.

medical_qa.question: Do minimally invasive retroperitoneoscopic surgery for psoas abscess with thoracolumbar tuberculosis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Minimally invasive retroperitoneoscopic surgery (MIS) for psoas abscess in patients with thoracolumbar tuberculosis is considered an effective diagnostic and therapeutic technique, showing benefits such as shorter hospital stay, minimal invasiveness, and quicker recovery.

medical_qa.question: Is cartilage thickness at the posterior medial femoral condyle increased in femorotibial knee osteoarthritis : a cross-sectional CT arthrography study ( Part 2 )?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Cartilage thickness at the non-weight-bearing posterior aspect of the medial condyle is increased in OA knees compared to non-OA knees. Cartilage thickness at the posterior aspect of the medial condyle increases with increasing K/L grade.

medical_qa.question: Does loss of Frzb and Sfrp1 differentially affect joint homeostasis in instability-induced osteoarthritis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: FRZB and SFRP1 have differential effects on joint homeostasis in the DMM model, impacting cartilage and subchondral bone differently.

medical_qa.question: Does tetraploid complementation prove pluripotency of induced pluripotent stem cells derived from adipose tissue?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Tetraploid complementation demonstrated pluripotency of induced pluripotent stem cells derived from adipose tissue.

medical_qa.question: Does implementation of the acute care surgery model provide benefits in the surgical treatment of the acute appendicitis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The ACS model may improve abdominal surgical efficiency and quality.

medical_qa.question: Is radiofrequency ablation plus devascularization the preferred treatment of hepatocellular carcinoma with esophageal varices?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Radiofrequency ablation plus devascularization is a treatment option for hepatocellular carcinoma with esophageal varices, especially in Child-Pugh class A patients below 50 years of age.

medical_qa.question: Is enhancement of in vitro activity of tuberculosis drugs by addition of thioridazine reflected by improved in vivo therapeutic efficacy?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Thioridazine is bactericidal towards Mtb in vitro, irrespective of mycobacterial growth rate, and enhances the activity of the standard regimen. However, this in vitro activity does not translate to improved therapeutic efficacy in a murine TB model.

medical_qa.question: Do youth walking and biking rates vary by environments around 5 Louisiana schools?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Walking and biking rates among students varied around 5 Louisiana schools, influenced by factors such as the walking/biking environment, distance from school, traffic speed, school encouragement, and student permission.

medical_qa.question: Does blockade of Central Angiotensin II AT1 Receptor protect the Brain from Ischemia/Reperfusion Injury in Normotensive Rats?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: AT1 receptor blockade with candesartan decreased ischemic brain injury and edema and improved neurological outcome.

medical_qa.question: Does syngap1 haploinsufficiency damage a postnatal critical period of pyramidal cell structural maturation linked to cortical circuit assembly?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Pathogenic Syngap1 mutations impact the dynamics and structural integrity of pyramidal cell postsynaptic structures involved in cortical circuit formation, suggesting disrupted critical periods of dendritic growth and spine plasticity may be common in developmental brain disorders.

medical_qa.question: Is pentraxin 3 reduced in bipolar disorder?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Levels of pentraxin 3 were significantly lower in individuals with bipolar disorder compared to controls, suggesting impaired innate immunity.

medical_qa.question: Are human enteroviruses the cause of neurological impairments in children at the Korle-Bu Teaching Hospital?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Non-polio enteroviruses and chikungunya virus were not found to be the cause of convulsions with neurological morbidity in children at the Korle-Bu Teaching Hospital. Further investigation for other viral agents is recommended.

medical_qa.question: Does a whole blood-based perfusate provide superior preservation of myocardial function during ex vivo heart perfusion?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: A whole blood-based perfusate (RBC+Plasma) minimizes injury and provides superior preservation of myocardial function during ex vivo heart perfusion.

medical_qa.question: Is elevated immune monitoring early after cardiac transplantation associated with increased plaque progression by intravascular ultrasound?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Elevated early immune monitoring scores are associated with progression of cardiac allograft vasculopathy by intravascular ultrasound, indicating a potential use for tailoring immunosuppressive regimens in high-risk patients.

medical_qa.question: Are successional changes in the chicken cecal microbiome during 42 days of growth independent of organic acid feed additives?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Temporal changes in the cecal microbiome were significant and consistent across treatments, while treatment effects on specific pathogens and the cecal microbiome as a whole were generally non-significant.

medical_qa.question: Does resveratrol enhance palmitate-induced ER stress and apoptosis in cancer cells?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Resveratrol promotes palmitate-induced cell death in cancer cells through inhibition of triglyceride accumulation, leading to lipid-mediated cell death via ER stress and CHOP-mediated apoptosis.

medical_qa.question: Is cDK1 and CDK2 activity a strong predictor of renal cell carcinoma recurrence?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: CDK1 and CDK2 activity are associated with recurrence and prognosis in renal cell carcinoma.

medical_qa.question: Is torsion of the optic nerve head a prominent feature of normal-tension glaucoma?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Normal-tension glaucoma eyes had a greater ONH torsion compared to POAG eyes with matched axial length.

medical_qa.question: Is endo first appropriate in some patients with critical limb ischemia because 'bridges are burned'?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Previous failed EV may predict poor outcomes in patients having distal OS for CLI.

medical_qa.question: Is unrecognized arteriosclerosis associated with wound complications after below-knee amputation?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Traditional markers of peripheral arterial disease were not predictive of wound complications after formalization of guillotine below-knee amputation for wet gangrene. Presence of microvascular disease on formal pathology was the only predictive factor for wound complications.

medical_qa.question: Does hydrogen sulfide reduce inflammation following abdominal aortic occlusion in rats?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Hydrogen sulfide has systemic and renal anti-inflammatory effects in remote IRI following aortic occlusion in rats.

medical_qa.question: Do seed bank dynamics govern persistence of Brassica hybrids in crop and natural habitats?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Hybrid persistence is highly dependent on seed bank dynamics, with seed bank survival being a key factor influencing hybrid population growth and persistence.

medical_qa.question: Is actinic keratosis with atypical basal cells (AK I) the most common lesion associated with invasive squamous cell carcinoma of the skin?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Direct invasion from proliferating basaloid atypical keratinocytes limited to the epidermal basal layer (AK I) was the most common form of progression to cutaneous iSCC in the study.

medical_qa.question: Does high-intensity intermittent exercise increase pulmonary interstitial edema at altitude but not at simulated altitude?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: High-intensity intermittent exercise led to an increase in B-lines at altitude after subacute exposure but not during acute exposure at equivalent simulated altitude, suggesting pulmonary interstitial edema.

medical_qa.question: Does mild cognitive dysfunction affect diabetes mellitus control in minority elderly adults?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Mild cognitive dysfunction did not significantly affect metabolic control in older adults with diabetes mellitus in this study.

medical_qa.question: Are anti-high mobility group box 1 ( anti-HMGB1 ) antibodies related to the occurrence of cutaneous lesions in systemic lupus erythematosus?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study suggests that anti-HMGB1 antibodies are unlikely to play a role in the development of cutaneous lesions in systemic lupus erythematosus.

medical_qa.question: Does alcohol disrupt levels and function of the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator to promote development of pancreatitis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Alcohol disrupts expression and localization of CFTR, contributing to pancreatitis development.

medical_qa.question: Does blood viscosity but not shear stress associate with delayed flow-mediated dilation?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Age and blood viscosity, but not the magnitude of shear stress, explain the different timing of the dilatory response to ischemia.

medical_qa.question: Does hypercholesterolemia increase the production of leukotriene B4 in neutrophils by enhancing the nuclear localization of 5-lipoxygenase?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Hypercholesterolemia increases LTB4 production in neutrophils by enhancing the nuclear localization of 5-LO through phosphorylation by activated ERK1/2.

medical_qa.question: Do molecular signatures of mood stabilisers highlight the role of the transcription factor REST/NRSF?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Transcription factor REST/NRSF is highlighted in the gene expression profile of genes associated with human mood disorders in response to mood stabilisers sodium valproate and lithium.

medical_qa.question: Does preconditioning of skeletal myoblast-based engineered tissue constructs enable functional coupling to myocardium in vivo?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Mechanical preconditioning of skeletal myoblast-based tissue constructs allows transplanted skeletal myoblasts to functionally interact with cardiomyocytes in vivo.

medical_qa.question: Does treatment with egg antigens of Schistosoma mansoni ameliorate experimental colitis in mice through a colonic T-cell-dependent mechanism?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Treatment with Schistosoma mansoni soluble egg antigens (SmSEA) reduced the severity of colitis in mice by increasing Th2 response and suppressing Th17 response in the colon.

medical_qa.question: Is abnormal left ventricular contractile response to exercise in the absence of obstructive coronary artery disease associated with resting left ventricular long-axis dysfunction?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: An abnormal LVCRE in the absence of established causes is associated with resting LV long-axis dysfunction and is usually seen in women.

medical_qa.question: Is sleep efficiency associated with grades in math and languages in healthy school-age children?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Sleep efficiency, but not sleep duration, is associated with academic performance as measured by report-card grades in typically developing school-aged children.

medical_qa.question: Are vitamin D levels and bone turnover markers related to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in severely obese patients?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Vitamin D and bone metabolism markers were not associated with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease or metabolic syndrome in severely obese patients.

medical_qa.question: Are outcomes of abdominal wall reconstruction with acellular dermal matrix affected by wound contamination?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Outcomes of abdominal wall reconstructions using acellular dermal matrix were similar between different CDC wound classifications, suggesting that ADM may be preferable to synthetic mesh in cases of wound contamination.

medical_qa.question: Does airway pressure release ventilation reduce conducting airway micro-strain in lung injury?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: APRV 75% in lung injury maintained micro-anatomic gas distribution similar to normal lungs, reducing conducting airway micro-strain.

medical_qa.question: Do a simplified method of preventing implant hex drive from aspiration or accidental swallowing during stage two implant recovery?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Tying the implant instruments to the operator's ring with silk ligatures or dental floss can prevent accidental aspiration or swallowing during routine implant surgeries.

medical_qa.question: Is late onset spinal motor neuronopathy caused by mutation in CHCHD10?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Mutation c.197G>T p.G66V in CHCHD10 is the cause of late onset spinal motor neuronopathy (LOSMoN/SMAJ).

medical_qa.question: Does low perfusion index affect the difference in glucose level between capillary and venous blood?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Perfusion index level obtained with the Masimo Radical-7(®) device can impact the comparability of capillary and venous glucose values in critical patients aged 18 years and over.

medical_qa.question: Are multiple pathways responsible for anti-inflammatory and cardiovascular activities of Hordeum vulgare L?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study suggests potential mechanisms behind the anti-inflammatory and cardiovascular effects of Hordeum vulgare L. in traditional medicine.

medical_qa.question: Does ITF increase the transcriptional activity of ITF promoter via the JAK-STAT3 signal transduction pathway?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Yes, ITF increases the transcriptional activity of ITF promoter via the JAK-STAT3 signal transduction pathway.

medical_qa.question: Does clinical evaluation of pazopanib eye drop versus ranibizumab intravitreal injections in subjects with neovascular age-related macular degeneration?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Pazopanib eye drops in neovascular AMD subjects did not provide additional therapeutic benefit compared to ranibizumab alone.

medical_qa.question: Does long-term treadmill exercise attenuate tau pathology in P301S tau transgenic mice?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Forced treadmill exercise in P301S tau transgenic mice showed greater benefits in the spinal cord compared to the brain, indicating potential limited benefits at later disease stages.

medical_qa.question: Does alpha and beta EEG power reflect L-dopa acute administration in parkinsonian patients?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Alpha and Beta EEG power significantly increased on centro-parietal scalp derivations after L-dopa intake, showing a negative correlation with UPDRS subscores for rigidity of arms and bradykinesia.

medical_qa.question: Does subclinical left ventricular dysfunction by echocardiographic speckle-tracking strain analysis relate to outcome in sarcoidosis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: LVGLS is impaired in sarcoidosis patients and independently associated with occurrence of cardiac events and/or development of CS.

medical_qa.question: Are guanine quadruplexes formed by specific regions of human transposable elements?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Guanine quadruplexes are specifically localized in the 3'-UTR of LINE-1 elements, in LTRs of HERV elements, and are strongly accumulated in specific regions of SVA elements in human retrotransposons.

medical_qa.question: Is circulating soluble LR11 enhanced after coronary stenting in response to vascular injury?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Circulating soluble LR11 levels were significantly increased on days 14 and 60 after coronary stenting in patients with stable angina pectoris.

medical_qa.question: Are de novo donor-specific HLA antibodies associated with early and high-grade bronchiolitis obliterans syndrome and death after lung transplantation?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study found that de novo donor-specific HLA antibodies are associated with accelerated bronchiolitis obliterans syndrome progression, increased severity, and death after lung transplantation.

medical_qa.question: Does a systematic review identify valid comorbidity indices derived from administrative health data?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: A systematic review identified valid comorbidity indices derived from administrative health data, with varying abilities to predict outcomes related to comorbidity.

medical_qa.question: Do comparative metabolomics in vegans and omnivores reveal constraints on diet-dependent gut microbiota metabolite production?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Residence in different societies influences gut microbiota composition, impacting the production of diet-dependent gut microbial metabolites.

medical_qa.question: Is disruption of SOX6 associated with a rapid-onset dopa-responsive movement disorder, delayed development, and dysmorphic features?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: SOX6 disruption is associated with a rapid-onset dopa-responsive movement disorder. Consider SOX6 mutations in the differential diagnosis of unexplained dopa-responsive dystonia syndromes.

medical_qa.question: Does capsular closure affect development of heterotopic ossification after hip arthroscopy?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Capsular closure did not alter the rate of heterotopic ossification compared to leaving the capsulotomy unrepaired.

medical_qa.question: Do smoking and unstable hinge fractures cause delayed gap filling irrespective of early weight bearing after open wedge osteotomy?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Osteotomy gap filling after open wedge high tibial osteotomy is delayed in smokers and in patients with unstable lateral hinge fractures. Early full weight bearing did not significantly affect the gap filling rate.

medical_qa.question: Is topical clobetasol in conjunction with topical tretinoin effective in preventing scar formation after superficial partial-thickness burn ulcers of the skin?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Clobetasol + tretinoin can significantly decrease the incidence of scar formation in patients with inflammation after re-epithelialization of superficial wounds.

medical_qa.question: Does the rate of hypo-osmotic challenge influence regulatory volume decrease ( RVD ) and mechanical properties of articular chondrocytes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The rate of hypo-osmotic challenge affects chondrocyte morphology and biomechanics by influencing regulatory volume decrease (RVD) and interaction with the actin cytoskeleton.

medical_qa.question: Does liver-specific deletion of augmenter of liver regeneration accelerate development of steatohepatitis and hepatocellular carcinoma in mice?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Liver-specific deletion of ALR in mice led to impaired mitochondrial function, lipid accumulation, and eventually the development of steatohepatitis and hepatocellular carcinoma.
